availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Manzer A. Payne (Graves County, hotel keeper and soldier)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, hotel keeper and soldier. New York native. Married to Catherine Payne. Father of Julia Payne, Olivia Payne, Rosa Payne, Dudley Payne, and Prentice Payne. Hotel keeper in Graves County in 1860. Served in the 1st Capital Guard regiment in the Kentucky State Militia as a major from August 16, 1864 to February 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, p. 52.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, Dublin Precinct, p. 1.
